TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MifareClassic extends Android.Nfc.Tech.BasicTagTechnology

Docs.summary: Provides access to MIFARE Classic properties and I/O operations on a .

remarks.para: Provides access to MIFARE Classic properties and I/O operations on a .
Acquire a object using .
MIFARE Classic is also known as MIFARE Standard.

MIFARE Classic tags are divided into sectors, and each sector is sub-divided into blocks. Block size is always 16 bytes (. Sector size varies.
MIFARE Classic Mini are 320 bytes (), with 5 sectors each of 4 blocks.
MIFARE Classic 1k are 1024 bytes (), with 16 sectors each of 4 blocks.
MIFARE Classic 2k are 2048 bytes (), with 32 sectors each of 4 blocks.
MIFARE Classic 4k} are 4096 bytes (). The first 32 sectors contain 4 blocks and the last 8 sectors contain 16 blocks.

MIFARE Classic tags require authentication on a per-sector basis before any other I/O operations on that sector can be performed. There are two keys per sector, and ACL bits determine what I/O operations are allowed on that sector after authenticating with a key. and .

Three well-known authentication keys are defined in this class: , , .
is the default factory key for MIFARE Classic.
is the well-known key for MIFARE Classic cards that have been formatted according to the MIFARE Application Directory (MAD) specification.
is the well-known key for MIFARE Classic cards that have been formatted according to the NXP specification for NDEF on MIFARE Classic.
Implementation of this class on a Android NFC device is optional. If it is not implemented, then will never be enumerated in . If it is enumerated, then all I/O operations will be supported, and NDEF tags will also be supported. In either case, will also be enumerated on the tag, because all MIFARE Classic tags are also .
See Also
Note: Methods that perform I/O operations require the permission.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool AuthenticateSectorWithKeyA (int sectorIndex, byte[] key);
.method public hidebysig instance bool AuthenticateSectorWithKeyA(int32 sectorIndex, unsigned int8[] key) cil managed

Docs.param: index of sector to authenticate, starting from 0
Docs.summary: Authenticate a sector with key A.

remarks.para: Authenticate a sector with key A.

Successful authentication of a sector with key A enables other I/O operations on that sector. The set of operations granted by key A key depends on the ACL bits set in that sector. For more information see the MIFARE Classic specification on .
A failed authentication attempt causes an implicit reconnection to the tag, so authentication to other sectors will be lost.
This is an I/O operation and will block until complete. It must not be called from the main application thread. A blocked call will be canceled with if is called from another thread.
Requires the permission.

Docs.exception: if the tag leaves the field
if there is an I/O failure, or the operation is canceled

This is an I/O operation and will block until complete. It must not be called from the main application thread. A blocked call will be canceled with if is called from another thread.

May cause RF activity and may block. Must not be called from the main application thread. A blocked call will be canceled with by calling from another thread.
Only one object can be connected to a at a time.
Applications must call when I/O operations are complete.
Requires the permission.

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Get the current timeout in milliseconds.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Get the current timeout in milliseconds.
Requires the permission.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the timeout in milliseconds.
The timeout only applies to on this object, and is reset to a default value when is called.
Setting a longer timeout may be useful when performing transactions that require a long processing time on the tag such as key generation.
Requires the permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] Transceive(unsigned int8[] data) cil managed

Docs.summary: Send raw NfcA data to a tag and receive the response.

remarks.para: Send raw NfcA data to a tag and receive the response.
This is equivalent to connecting to this tag via and calling . Note that all MIFARE Classic tags are based on technology.
Use to retrieve the maximum number of bytes that can be sent with .
This is an I/O operation and will block until complete. It must not be called from the main application thread. A blocked call will be canceled with if is called from another thread.
Requires the permission.
